Reviews.Content: Not what I had expected We arrived and checked right in on December 29, 2008. The room was clean. This Laquinta at Cutler Ridge is in the middle of a rough neighborhood and next to a freeway, a gas station and another hotel. For just an overnight stay is o.k., but would not recommend for long stays especially with children.
Reviews.Author: wktd

Reviews.Content: Good deal for a short stay This hotel is very good for those people who need a stop before arriving to the keys. Too far away from Miami, not for the distance but for the traffic (1 hour for arriving to Miami beach!). This is not a safe zone to walk around but hotel is safe and well controlled. Rooms are not so very clean, the carpet is old and dirty but acceptable considering the price. They鈥檙e quite big, with refrigerator and microwave but zero space for the cloths! That鈥檚 why I said is good for short stays. Breakfast is included and ok, wireless internet is in all rooms, free but a little slow. People mostly speak Spanish and not so kind but if you need help, at least they give it.
Reviews.Author: selbyhs

Reviews.Content: Nice deal We paid 65 USD for a room with two queen bed.Nice room. Nice hotel. Very kind and helpfull staff.Located VERY near the turnpike and we knew before booking that there would be a bit noise, but not bad at all.Breakfast OK. The price was very good and we experienced a good value for money.
Reviews.Author: Seaplane

Reviews.Content: great value I picked up a coupon book at the interstate rest stop, and got a great rate on this hotel. Appeared to be very new hotel. Free continental breakfast had more than the average hotel, with a waffle maker. If one is on the way to the Key's or the Everglades, or wants to visit the Coral Castle, it's in a good spot The kids enjoyed the pool, but it wasn't very large. We got a late start on breakfast and the staff went out of their way to bring back out stuff even after they had taken it up.
Reviews.Author: tlandin

Reviews.Content: Reasonable but dated The inn was a previous Baymont Inn, old,dated worn out furniture with cigarette burns on the sofa and all tables in the room. The room was very clean, but musty smelling from the old carpet and furnishings. This is not a safe stay area, in my opinion, nor would I stay there again out of the safety feeling. Overall, the hotel was very clean and ok for one night only if you can't find anything else. The price was reasonable. I would advise not venture outside on foot at night.
Reviews.Author: oxyk

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this La Quinta We stayed at the LaQuinta Cutler Ridge one night before a cruise. This hotel was very nice. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. There is a nice small pool. It's a good value and included a nice breakfast with bagels, cereal and waffles. It is about 20 minutes from downtown Miami. We would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: MaryB4

Reviews.Content: great hotel great value very clean very clean and comfortable, great value for the price.breakfast was included and was excellent. would stay there again when in Miami and recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: ruthgerry

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel We stayed here for 2 nights, we selected this hotel primarily on price and location, its 30mins from Miami Beach and not to far from the Florida Keys, the room was clean and comfortable and breakfast was ok with waffles, cereal, toast, coffee juice etc. We would stay here again if we needed to pass through that area.
Reviews.Author: Flep

Reviews.Content: Suburban No-Frills Motel The La Quinta Inn (formerly the Baymont Inn) is located about 20-30 minutes south of the Miami International Airport. The property is located just a block from the South Dade Busway Caribbean Rd. stop ($1.50) which runs to/from Tri Rail and Downtown Miami. It is also located directly across the street from the Southland Mall, which features anchor stores like K-Mart, Sears and JC Penny. I found this hotel by naming my price on Priceline*com, where a bid of just $55/night got me in. [The hotel's website was showing $119/nt.]This 4 story building is in a mildly-noisy-at-times area of the city, wedged between a Mc Donald's and a gas station. The hotel offers complimentary parking and continental breakfast each morning. Other amenities include vending  ice machines on each floor, 24 hour front desk, small swimming pool and a small laundrette ($1.25 each for wash/dry).The reasonably-sized rooms offer a comfortable plush bed (an unexpected treat!), 25 cable tv with Showtime and a huge assortment of LodgeNet PPV movies, COMPLIMENTARTY HIGH SPEED INTERNET, recliner chair, ample lamps, iron  ironing board, windows that open and a ceiling fan. Water pressure was fine and the massaging shower head was another perk. Daily service was fine and kudos to the housekeeping team that did not disturb money left on the desk accidentally half-way through my stay. Maintenance of the property was okay - it could use some new paint here and there (guestroom bathrooms) and some general preventative maintenance.Aside from the complimentary breakfast, there is no dining at the property. There's many fast food restaurants in the area - Mc Donalds, Arby's, Burger King, Little Ceasar's (in the K-Mart) and others. There's also an Applebee's and a Tony Roma's within a mile of the hotel. There are pizza and chinese food delivery options - just ask the front desk for menus.In closure, I found this property to meet all expectations and would return if visiting the area again. Happy and safe travels!!
Reviews.Author: WookinPahNub

Reviews.Content: Overbooked Rooms We booked out trip via Orbitz and paid in full. When we arrived we were told that they had no reservation for us. After spending two hours on the phone contacting Orbitz and Baymont Central Reservations, both of which had our reservations in their systems, we were told that the hotel had been overbooked locally and we would have to stay somewhere else.While we were there, two other couples came in and had the exact same problem we had (and they had used other online travel sites). Another woman came in and had changed her reservations a few weeks prior from one room to two rooms, but only one room was available.This was a holiday weekend and only one employee was working. The lobby was dirty with stained, torn, and broken furniture. Ceiling tiles missing and overall it was very dirty. If the rooms look anything like the lobby, I'm glad we didn't stay there!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: This Motel is Fine This motel is average. The rooms are decent. Clean and well maintained. The rooms have a newer look but it appears it has been a few years since a remodel. A little wear around the edges but still in very good shape. We had 3 rooms and all were about the same. The breakfast buffet area is fine but the carpets are quite stained. The selections were quite the norm for a budget motel chain. The area nearby is a little rough but we found no problems day or night. They have a security guard at night in the parking area and they lock all of their doors late night including the front entrance so you must have your card key. The hotel is set back off the road and is very quiet. I heard no noise from outside of the hotel ever. McDonalds is adjacent to rhe hotel. There is a K-Mart across the street and a mall with a Macy's, Sears, J.C. Penney, large food court and other stores.I bid thru Priceline and got this for $34 per night so I really can't complain except it is way too far from Miami Beach due to the traffic on U.S. 1.If it were closer to Miami I would stay again.There is an independent Mexican semi-fast food type restaurant on the same block which I would recommend. Being a Los Angeles resident, I know Mexican food and it is pretty bad in Miami but this place is decent (especially for non-Mexicans cooking).
Reviews.Author: CalItalian

Reviews.Content: Bugs! This hotel is very misrepresented in its photos on the Baymont website and on the descriptions of it on travel sites. The rooms are renovated, which means that they have one new secondhand lamp, but the rest of the room is still VERY old and gross. There were bugs crawling out of the wall, which the front desk person said were throughout the hotel due to in-house coffee (what? I didn't find bugs at the other local hotels with coffee!) and could come out of any room at any time.Also, there were cobwebs in the corners, stains on every surface, no pillow-tops matresses (despite the description), very old bathrooms with stained tile, a cheap and dirty plastic shower/surround, and the wall above the shower was falling apart  falling into the shower. The decor was not as it appeared in the photos on the Baymont website; it was very cheap-looking and in guady colors. And, even through it was a second-floor room, there were bars across the window, which didn't make it feel like a safe area.We left immediately and went to a different hotel in the area (that didn't have any bugs). This hotel is NOT worth the price; unless you want to cuddle up with the bugs at night and stare through the bars on the window to the view of pavement and buildings.
Reviews.Author: landlockedinIL

Reviews.Content: This Hotel is abolutely awful.... Spent 2 nights in this embarassment on FEB. 19 and 20 ...... Pros- It is 1 minute off of Florida's turnpike, so it made for a convenient in-between spot between our travels from Orlando to Key West.... complimentary breakfast was bearable, although they ran out of coffee both mornings....everything seemed fresh. They didn't charge for a crib. The suite was good-sized. Although they weren't very helpful, the staff was friendly.  That's it...the only positive things I can sayCons- I requested a non-smoking room a month in adavance. Was told that they had no non-smoking rooms left, but that they would upgrade me to a non-smoking suite at no extra charge. I thought that was great. Checked 2 weeks prior to stay and was told that I had a non-smoking suite. Got to the hotel, asked if I still had a non-smoking suite. The woman behind the desk smiled and said yes...Went to the room and it was a smelly Smoking suite. Wound up being told that was all that they had.This was a real treat for us non-smokers. Cigarette burns on everything...stains on bedspreads.  Neighborhood is a little shady.......Conevenience store next door is the type where Cashier is surround by bulletproof glass... Housekeeping was atrocious. didnt clean the coffee pot or replenish coffe supplies, clean the toothpaste and hair from the sink or change the linens..It looked like she all she time to do was give us fresh towels and pick up the tip that I had left her in advance.  Just a quick story..my wife was going to do some laundry and went down to get change from the front desk.The gentleman said that he had no change. 10 minutes later, I sent my 15 year old niece that was traveling with us for change. The same gentleman had all the change that she needed..... Overall, this hotel is a joke and based on my experience, will never stay in a Baymont Inn again....
Reviews.Author: dillhate

Reviews.Content: Wow!  My husband  I checked in on 02/19/05-02/21/05. What a disappointment!! First we asked for a non-smoking room, well they assigned us a smoking room. This room was just disgusting. It had cigarette burns all over on counters, carpets  bedding. The chair in the room was missing. The remote control for the tv was being repaired (so they said). I mentioned to the desk clerk that they put us in the wrong room. She said they had no more rooms left. I insisted on talking to a manager who than gave us a suite. That wasn't much better. The sink had bugs crawling all over it . We kept killing them but they just kept coming back. We put up with that for 2 days. I couldn't wait to get out of there. I will never stay at a Baymont Inn again. This is my second bad experience in 1 week with them.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not Bad Good Price I usually stay at more expensive hotels because I don't enjoy dealing with cleanliness problems. I have never stayed at a Baymont, but decided to give it a try since I was only paying about $65.00 a night, it was close to miami, and I wouldn't be spending any time in the room. As far as cleanliness, it was not up to what I would expect, but truely the only problem was the stained carpet. In the room there was just a spot here and there, but in the continental breakfast area it was oretty bad. Also, there is a noise that occurs every few minutes day and night that you can hear on one side of the hotel. Light sleepers may want to ask for the other side. Overall, I would certainly stay here again. It would be a perfect place if they replaced the carpeting. I stayed there Jan. 2005
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Op茅rationnel et confortable       l'entr茅e (脿 droite l'autoroute, 脿 gauche, le parking, la piscine)
Reviews.Author: verofifi

Reviews.Content: La Quinta Inn Miami - einfach und solide   showReview(11392660, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
